reviewText: Transatlantic will always be one of those bands that will be overlooked by members of the baby boom generation who like YES, Genesis, Gentle Giant, etc.  All four members of this band worked together like a well oiled machine.  Any fans of their CD's should also own this DVD.  Filmed in late 2001 in Holland it captures both the uniqueness and genius of this band.  There is not a bad cut or video on this DVD.  You get a good cross section of both Transatlantic studio efforts.  The DVD of the show is approximately 2 1/2 hours and that is not counting the bonus footage.  Right out of the shoot it opens with DUEL WITH THE DEVIL from their second studio CD.  Highlights for this viewer where the live version of MY NEW WORLD and ALL OF THE ABOVE.  But, you also get WE ALL NEED SOME LIGHT, STRANGER IN YOUR SOUL, and the Beatlesque SUITE CHARLOTTE PIKE MEDLEY.  Watching this DVD it seems like only 30 minutes went by, it is that good visually and musically.  It grabs you and does not let go.  I've viewed other music DVD's and on many of them, by half way through, I just got to take a break.  That is not the case with TRANSATLANTIC: LIVE IN EUROPE.When one views this DVD you have to ask yourself, why weren't these guys signed by any of the major music labels?  Yeah, I know, they're no Dave Mathews, yawn, Matchbox 20 double yawn.  It is a damn shame that great music from groups like Transatlantic are relegated to Prog fan niche musical ghetto.This is a buy and tell your friends.
summary: Proves the major music labels got their heads up....
Title: N/A

reviewText: The trully fascinating thing I find about this amazing concert is that it was filmed in front of 2000 people or so. Each instrument is perfectly miked (everything sounds like it should). It is a pleasure to see these "musical titans" in action doing what they do best: complete domination of their music and instruments.Get it!!
summary: Best live concert DVD I've seen in a long time!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Bland, boring - say what you will, but this isn't rock & roll, just pop drivel. Strum away all night guys, but market correctly: this is watered-down, derivative, wholesome folk rock for geezers. Portnoy is obviously drunk, as he simply goes through the motions, playing extremely basic first-year rock licks, thinking of his paycheck. The real trouble with this package is the coat-tail grabbing desperation of the Pink Floyd cover. DO NOT expect any "transcendental" musicianship or quality, just annoying & pointless effluvia, trite arrangements, and hackneyed psychedelic C-list has-beens.
Title: N/A

reviewText: The three Transatlantic fans in our household (ranging in age from nine to forty-nine) gathered last night to watch Live In Europe, and we were all just floored by it. The sound quality (as played through very high-end audio equipment) was excellent, and the general technical quality of the disk is fine, but the performances are just outstanding.Neal Morse looks like he's enjoying performing more than anyone I've ever seen on stage. His vocals were better live than I thought they would be. All of the band chips in vocals, but Neal and Roine Stolt are the ones that you'll love listening to.Watching Mike Portnoy do drums is a real treat. That boy must be in great physical condition to bang his way through those half-hour epics, with high energy and sharp drumming all the way.Pete Trewavas serves up fine bass, with a couple of opportunities to shine, reminding me of Chris Squire's extra gigs in Yes concerts. Roine Stolt is, of course, one of the better guitar players in rock, and shows it. I was a bit surprised to see a relatively low-key performance from him. I suppose in a normal concert it would not have been noticeable, but compared to the high energy of the other members, it was.I'd never heard of Daniel Gildenlöw of Pain of Salvation, who was added to provide some depth in guitar and keyboards, but he's quite good and also enjoys being there.Most of the music from their two albums is here, but I was most impressed by Stranger in Your Soul. I also found the live rendition of We All Need Some Light to be powerful. And they take advantage of the fact that Suite Charlotte Pike is a fairly disconnected song to insert a bunch of classic Beatles at the transition points. You might think that would be really strange, but somehow it works well, and really showed the guys as well-rounded musicians. I was particularly surprised at how well Neal did vocals that were originally from Paul McCartney.We also had two guests at the house for part of the concert. They sat in for three songs (which meant over an hour) and were very intrigued. They asked things like "Why haven't we ever heard of these guys?" I echo another reviewer - a major label needs to get these fellows producing more music. And that way, we'd also get to see them in concert again.All in all, the experience was comparable to going to see a real live show, and it's a lot less hit-or-miss. If you like prog rock, you're almost sure to love it.
summary: Skip your next live concert and buy this instead
Title: N/A

reviewText: El final del 2003 nos dejo un dulce recuerdo a todosaquellos que respiramos, sentimos, comemos ytranspiramos rock.Transatlantic, por fin , luego de esperar por casi dosaños, lanzo al mercado el dvd live in Europe. Unconcierto grabado en holanda en la ultima gira quediera este magnifico proyecto, conformado por NeilMorse ( teclados y vocales ), quien por esa época aunformaba parte de Spock's Beard, Peter Trewavas bajistade Marillion, Roine stolt guitarrista de Flower Kingsy Mike Portnoy Baterista de Dream Theater acompañadospor Daniel Gilden de la banda Pain of Salvation.Este concierto es un tributo al mas puro y refinadoRock Progresivo, en donde encontramos el virtuosismointerpretativo sin arabescos emperifollados ni ínfulasde grandes maestros de la música, cada nota, cadatiempo, cada melodía, esta compuesta e interpretada enel momento oportuno, no es un concierto con baliarinesbrincando por el escenario como si estuvieran conataques de epilepsia o juegos de luces para que sevean desde marte , ni montajes estrafalarios, es unapresentación en donde lo importante es la música y losmúsicos, no se necesita nada mas.En cuanto a lo técnico encontramos una producción muybien lograda tanto en la parte visual como en lesonido, todo es claro la mezcla de vídeo y audio estánrealizadas de manera muy profesional.Live en Europe nos trae dos dvd's en el dvd 1 elconcierto y el dvd 2 trae un pequeño documental de lagira de la banda mas el tema de Pink Floyd Shine onyou crazy diamond interpretado en el NAMM show, fotos,enfin, todo lo que un amante del progresivo puedeesperar.Sin ser vidente ni, tener bola mágica me atrevo abaticinar que este trabajo será seguramente el mejordel año 2003 en la categoría de dvd.
Title: N/A

reviewText: A great "final" performance for this super prog band. It's interesting that in the "documentary" they all hope to come back to Transatlantic in 3 or 4 years, in the light of Neal recently saying "I Quit!" to TA and his old group Spock's Beard. This set is leaps and bounds ahead of the Live in America set with a lot less Neal and Mike goofing on the mike...though surprisingly Pete takes the opportunity for that here (as well as taking the opportunity to show off some amazing vocals and bass work)! Roine is in great form and with Daniel helping them out, the vocal and arrangement depth is tremendous. To just think what this band could produce given proper studio and rehersal time! I say we start to really hound them in a year or two to get it back together for just one more time. Yes - only 6 songs - but heck it's 150 minutes of music!The second disc contains some video footage of other shows, and to me, there's plenty of room on these discs to have included some of these "bootleg" style shows in their entirety as DVD extras. Mostly to make those shows available outside the bootleg market, but also because there wasn't any cost to including them. The hardcore fans of these guys wouldn't care about the warts and all aspect of the video.The version of Shine On You Crazy Diamond from the NAMM show, to me, is getting close to what Roine talks about in the documentary about how he would like TA to be more dynamic and willing to improv. Shine On is a good ambient quiet to loud piece that allows for a lot of improv and movement and they do it well here. I can easily see them doing similar original pieces - so yes Roine, get the guys together and work on it! They use the NAMM version I'm sure because it's a good version while many of the versions they "romped" through on the tour were iffy at best...particulary the Tilberg performance.The only "grievance", (besides their possibly never working together again) would be that they should have saved the Abbey Road material for the "encore" and performed it as a big rock show finish after having played all the more intense TA material previous. I can't believe Mike wanted them to play Heart of the Sunrise on top of everything else - that would have been KILLER!Hopefully they got one more in them...can't some major label offer them like millions of dollars to continue working together? no? Ha! ;-)
summary: What a way to go out!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Every once in a while you come across bands that you just wish would have that "something" that would make the music and the mood just perfect. Well, the search stops here. This DVD is a masterpiece. I believe the magic that usually takes a while to happen on stage with your average band (if it happens) is a constant with Transatlantic. I believe Neal Morse has a deal with the stars, or God for that matter, not because he's super technical but because this human being plays for the song, not for the ego. I am a drummer and while I would naturally be inclined to dissect every single bit of what Portnoy does,  listening and watching this DVD actually made me enjoy the music as something magic, because well, it is magic performed by all these guys. I trully believe that all Transatlantic members are superior human beings. The songs they perform give fuel to the soul, they lift the spirit. Not a lot of bands can do that. Do yourself a favor and buy this DVD. You will feel better and better every time you watch and listen to it.
summary: THIS IS THE REDEFINITION OF WHAT TALENT IS
Title: N/A
